subject: Science
title: Earth's Magnetic Field
description: A short lesson to help you apply Earth's Magnetic Field.

hook.text: Earth acts like a giant magnet â€” and without its field, life might not exist.

buildup.text: Molten iron flowing in Earth's outer core generates a magnetic field through dynamo action.

discovery.text: This field extends thousands of km into space, forming the magnetosphere.

twist.text: The magnetic poles flip every few hundred thousand years. We're overdue for a reversal.

climax.text: The magnetosphere deflects solar wind. Without it, radiation would strip away our atmosphere.

punchline.text: A river of liquid iron shields us from solar radiation. An invisible armor.

quiz.question: What generates Earth's magnetic field?
options: Flowing molten iron in the outer core
